data.title: Decoding Alejandro Jodorowsky
data.meta_description: The brightest part of my 2023 was lying in a London park, as spring gave over to a glorious summer, reading the Jodorowsky-Moebius collection, The Incal (1981–1988). This was a book that I found…
data.text:
Trigger warning: Discussions of sexual violence in the film industry

The brightest part of my 2023 was lying in a London park, as spring gave over to a glorious summer, reading the Jodorowsky-Moebius collection, The Incal (1981–1988). This was a book that I found accidentally in a council library. Weirdly, I was in that library too, at that time, because of a cascade of other accidents. I had no place to go. I knew nothing about Jodorowsky. Weirdly, though I would eventually develop deep reservations about the philosophy, applying some Jodorowskian tricks and hacks to my life, I am in much better shape — mentally, artistically, and otherwise — than I have ever been before.
